text: Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory is a 1971 American musical fantasy movie directed by Mel Stuart. It stars Gene Wilder as Willy Wonka and Jack Albertson as Grandpa Joe. It is a movie version of the 1964 novel Charlie and the Chocolate Factory by Roald Dahl. Filming took place in Munich in 1970. It was released by Paramount Pictures on June 30, 1971. The movie became highly popular in part through repeated television airings and home entertainment sales. In 1972, the movie received an Academy Award nomination for Best Original Score, and Wilder was nominated for a Golden Globe as Best Actor in a Musical or Comedy, but lost both awards. In 2014, the movie was selected for preservation in the United States National Film Registry by the Library of Congress as being "culturally, historically, or aesthetically significant". ==Notes== ==References== ==Other websites== * * * * Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory at AFI Catalog of Feature Films * Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory essay by Brian Scott Mednick at National Film Registry Category:1971 fantasy movies Category:1971 musical movies Category:American musical fantasy movies Category:United States National Film Registry movies Category:Movies based on books Category:Movies about children Category:Movies about families Category:Movies about scientists Category:Movies about technology Category:Movies about industrial espionage Category:Movies set in factories Category:Movies set in England Category:Movies set in Germany Category:Movies set in Montana Category:Movies set in Arizona Category:Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (franchise) Category:1970s English-language movies Category:Paramount Pictures movies Category:Academy Award winning movies
title: Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory
